Header: Turkey captures sister of slain IS leader Baghdadi in northern Syria
Content: Turkey captured the sister of slain Islamic State leader Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi in the northern Syrian town of Azaz, and is interrogating her and her husband and daughter-in-law who were also detained. Rasmiya Awad, 65, was detained in a raid near Azaz, the official said, referring to a Turkish-controlled Syrian town near the border. When captured, she was also accompanied by five children. Little independent information is available on Baghdadiâ€™s sister and Reuters was not immediately able to verify if the captured individual was her. Baghdadi killed himself last month when cornered in a tunnel during a raid by U.S. Special Forces in northwestern Syria.
